column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Create Code of Conduct
username_0: This project, I am afraid, lacks proper and **inclusive** CoC.
As of right now there is no obvious way for a disabled trans person to contribute to this project other than to obey the normative rules derived from the patriarchal world, something we must strive to change. As a trans-race biPoC of color, and disabled non-genius (I induced clinical retardation by lowering my IQ from 140 to roughly 100 with microdosing) I feel obliged to remind you to write proper CoC for this project, since I don't feel safe around all non-trans people.
Thank you for your time.
<issue_comment>username_1: As of right now there is no obvious way for a disabled trans person to contribute to this project other than to obey the normative rules derived from the patriarchal world, something we must strive to change. As a trans-race biPoC of color, and disabled non-genius (I induced clinical retardation by lowering my IQ from 140 to roughly 100 with microdosing) I feel obliged to remind you to write proper CoC for this project, since I don't feel safe around all non-trans people.
Thank you for your time. 

Profile pic matches up, yep he's trolling
<issue_comment>username_0: yes, thats the type of behavior I am trying to avoid, right now without CoC, people like me are left to the sharks
<issue_comment>username_1: As of right now there is no obvious way for a disabled trans person to contribute to this project other than to obey the normative rules derived from the patriarchal world, something we must strive to change. As a trans-race biPoC of color, and disabled non-genius (I induced clinical retardation by lowering my IQ from 140 to roughly 100 with microdosing) I feel obliged to remind you to write proper CoC for this project, since I don't feel safe around all non-trans people.
Thank you for your time.

Profile pic matches up, yep he's trolling

yes, thats the type of behavior I am trying to avoid, right now without CoC, people like me are left to the sharks

You're actually trolling. Before you had a based pepe profile picture lol.
<issue_comment>username_0: and how does this nice looking bear with cowboy hat refute your argument exactly? I can still be trolling even with that pic
nevertheless, my pic is not to be commented here
<issue_comment>username_1: @LukeSmithxyz close.
<issue_comment>username_0: @LukeSmithxyz don't close it, before you create a proper CoC.
<issue_comment>username_2: suggestion for CoC: don't be a dick and treat other people how you want to be treated
opinion: this is an unstated rule of just being a normal person
conclusion: we don't need a CoC
<issue_comment>username_3: Create a privilege lookup table by assigning a privilege value to each trait (race, gender, etc)

Then ban anyone below a certain privilege threshold from interacting with the project in any way so we don't have to see posts like this ever again
<issue_comment>username_0: this is something I can stand behind, but not banning, rather empower them proportionate to their missing points in privilege<issue_closed>

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Update Brand Tagline
username_0: I think it would be great if we could come up with something more inclusive for v2 ü§ò 

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on issues](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-new-issues)?

Yes ü¶ñ
<issue_comment>username_1: cc @username_2
<issue_comment>username_0: Bolded changes
<issue_comment>username_2: I am good with something along the lines of the proposals from @username_1 or @username_0
<issue_comment>username_1: I like "Docusaurus helps you to build powerful websites quickly, enabling you to focus on your content". Thoughts? @username_3 @wgao19 @lex111
<issue_comment>username_3: i like ‚ÄúDocusaurus helps you to build powerful websites quickly, enabling you to focus on your content‚Äù but after some thinking, what do we mean by ‚Äúpowerful‚Äù. Calling website ‚Äúpowerful‚Äù sounds weird to me üòÜ

‚Äúmaintainable‚Äù or ‚Äústable‚Äù could be right (but the word isnt fancy enough)

how about ‚Äúeffective‚Äù or ‚Äúefficient‚Äù üò±üòÖüòÖüòÖü§£ü§£
<issue_comment>username_3: long-lasting :)
<issue_comment>username_1: I think let's go with something like "optimized websites"?<issue_closed>

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Establish sponsor logo settings/guides
username_0: Need to clarify a few things, and then update the code and the README to reflect. 

1) Sponsor logos should NOT have a border in the image file itself
2) Do we think there should be a border around the images? If so this will be done in CSS
3) Confirm standard size of logos. 

Please discuss :)
<issue_comment>username_1: While not normally a fan of borders on images, I prefer them _with the current layout_. Because orgs have all different shapes and sizes of logos they tend to blend together or look jumbled if there's nothing consistent about them.
<issue_comment>username_0: Interestingly, in the new setup where the logos are consistent this might not be a thing.
<issue_comment>username_2: My vote is to keep all logos 100x100 with no border. We can handle any styling with the CSS.
<issue_comment>username_0: I also agree that there should be no borders on the images themselves. We will update docs to reference this. I'm keeping the issue open until the docs have been updated.
<issue_comment>username_0: Question to self - what docs do I think are supposed to be updated? I am not sure that our current docs say anything about the sponsor logo files (well the README says they have to be png and how to name them; I guess that's what I meant?)
<issue_comment>username_3: Should we be a little more explicit on the file format? We probably ought to specify dimensions (200px square. Images show as 100px square, but 200px will kick in for retina). Also, should we specify PNG-8 and run through something like ImageOptim?
<issue_comment>username_4: I don't world wide web that well. What sorcery is required to have images upscale to retina automagically? :)
<issue_comment>username_3: Retina is wonderful because it's lazy magic: You don't need to do anything other than send an image that's double the dimensions.

Right now we're [specifying logos as 95px wide in the html](https://github.com/devopsdays/devopsdays-web/blob/master/themes/devopsdays-legacy/layouts/partials/event_footer.html#L17).

- If you send a a 95px wide image to a non-retina device, the browser just displays it.
- If you send a 95px wide image to a retina device, it makes up the extra pixels and usually looks a bit blurry.
- If you send a 190px wide image to a non-retina device, the browser scales it down and it in nearly all cases it looks good.
- If you send a 190px wide image to a retina device, it gets to display all the pixely goodness.
<issue_comment>username_4: Ah, lovely!

Proposals:
* Set official image dimensions to 200px square, with no hard border. üëç
* Harness the awesome power of HTML to constrain said image to 100px square. üëç
* Utilise stylistic sheets of a cascading nature to draw a border around the image AS IF BY MAGIC. üëç

`r?` @username_0
<issue_comment>username_4: @username_3 This appears to come in two flavours: OS X and a beta Web API, the former of which we can safely discard as a possibility. Are you familiar with the Web API - what's the user story look like there?
<issue_comment>username_0: I agree with the proposed README updates, @username_4. Make it so :)

Regarding the ImageOptim thing, I would say let's add using something similar to the docs, but there really is no way we can "enforce" this. Personally, I do my optimizations with CodeKit2, but that's a Mac only story. I think that simply requesting folks use their own judgement on this one is fine, but it's a really good idea to put in some links to some good options for doing it.
<issue_comment>username_4: Utilise stylistic sheets of a cascading nature to draw a border around the image AS IF BY MAGIC. 

What is (or should be?) the canonical method for actually *doing* these two things?
<issue_comment>username_0: Those things are done in the core code of the site - events cannot actually do it themselves. So those two items don't need to be in the docs (other than as reference maybe?)
<issue_comment>username_4: Fair enough.  I'll modify the documentation appropriately; that said, where should we be making these changes in the core code of the site?  I'm not at all up to speed on Hugo or our implementation of it.
<issue_comment>username_0: This is where it would happen (at least this is where the sponsor images get drawn):

https://github.com/devopsdays/devopsdays-web/blob/master/themes%2Fdevopsdays-legacy%2Flayouts%2Fpartials%2Fevent_footer.html#L17

This is where the CSS can be fixed:

https://github.com/devopsdays/devopsdays-web/blob/master/themes%2Fdevopsdays-legacy%2Fstatic%2Fcss%2Fstyle.css#L72
<issue_comment>username_4: I can't help but notice that those links point to the "legacy" theme - are we using this theme throughout, or?

Sorry if these are dumb questions. üòï
<issue_comment>username_0: Yes, the "legacy" theme is the one that matches the "current" devopsdays website look and feel.

The `devopsdays` theme is where we can be working on new UX, etc.
<issue_comment>username_5: Hi, @username_4 - is this issue done? I ask because I don't see the CSS borders when building locally, although I do see them on github.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_5 do you still not see the borders? I see them on http://devopsdays.github.io

If you do correctly see the borders, we can close this issue as complete.
<issue_comment>username_4: @username_5 @username_0 Yes, I see the CSS borders when building locally.
<issue_comment>username_0: Okay this seems to be working.<issue_closed>

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Please improve the documentation of the Right-Click context menu for Power Off
username_0: Well, it DOES (obliquely) mention the right click context menu.  However nowhere on the page does it mention "power off".  I would recommend this page get a small update saying:

If the Shutdown fails (e.g. the VM is hung and not responding to the soft shutdown request) then you can force power-off the VM by right clicking the Virtual Machine and using the Power Off method in the menu.
<issue_comment>username_1: Updating the Virtual Machine Management Guide in the downstream - RHV 4.4
https://gitlab.cee.redhat.com/rhci-documentation/docs-Red_Hat_Enterprise_Virtualization/-/merge_requests/1853
<issue_comment>username_2: This will be solved on next documentation sync
<issue_comment>username_3: Documentation updates done update 
already published in 

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_virtualization/4.4/html-single/virtual_machine_management_guide/index#Shutting_down_a_virtual_machine

and in 
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_virtualization/4.4/html-single/virtual_machine_management_guide/index#Suspending_a_virtual_machine<issue_closed>

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: python/grains: mentoring doc improvements
username_0: * Apply reST docstring formatting
* Make headers consistent with all other Python mentoring files
* Add a problem spec
* Fix power operator (the code sample doesn't actually do what it shows/intends)
* Document bitwise shift operator

@kotp  for review
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0  - To my knowledge, we're not using reST docstring formatting.   The edits you've made are not consistent with what is in the repo for docstrings.

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: FAQ google_security_vulnerability
username_0: 
<issue_comment>username_0: Internal Tracking ID: [EXPOSUREAPP-6979](https://jira-ibs.wbs.net.sap/browse/EXPOSUREAPP-6979)
<issue_comment>username_1: I'd suggest to change it to:
On April 27, 2021, reports appeared that announced a vulnerability in the Exposure Notification Framework (ENF) in the Android operating system. This vulnerability allowed `manufacturer` pre-installed `system` apps on Android smartphones to access system log files, thus reading ENF data that is also provided by the Corona-Warn-App (CWA). Google has provided a fix for Android, and says that it has now been rolled out up to 98%. All Android versions that use the Google Play Services below version 21.15 are affected.

Also, the title is still German :)
Information zur bereits von Google geschlossenen Sicherheitl√ºcke im Exposure Notification Framework
<issue_comment>username_2: I'm on the German title in the English FAQ. PR follows ASAP
<issue_comment>username_1: Another suggestion: Maybe it could also be added to the text:
"There are no known reports so far, that system apps of manufacturers actually gathered privacy disclosing ENF data."
As to my best knowledge, it could have been abused, but I did not read anything that it was done...
<issue_comment>username_1: No privacy disclosing data from CWA appear in the system logs (was provided by CWA). It was all from Google's ENS logging.
<issue_comment>username_1: Just FYI: the relevant data looked like this, for example (I replaced original data with random values):

```logcat
04-22 21:07:47.477  3577 23655 I ExposureNotification: getCurrentRollingProximityId: generated a new RollingProximityId=A1B2C3D4E5F6G7H8I9ABABABABABABFF [CONTEXT service_id=236 ]
...
04-22 21:07:50.601  3577 23655 I ExposureNotification: Start advertising with packet (AdvertiseData [mServiceUuids=[0000fd6f-0000-1000-8000-00aa09bb0acc], mManufacturerSpecificData={}, mServiceData={0000fd6f-0000-1000-8000-00aa09bb0acc=[-11, 22, -33, 44, 55, 66, -77, -88, -99, 100, -111, 112, 113, 114, 115, 116, -117, 118, 119, 120]}, mIncludeTxPowerLevel=false, mIncludeDeviceName=false]) mode: ADVERTISE_MODE_BALANCED tx power level ADVERTISE_TX_POWER_LOW [CONTEXT service_id=236 ]
```
<issue_comment>username_1: Actually, I think one of the devs should have a look over the texts again.
Pinging @mlenkeit and @username_3 here in the first place.
<issue_comment>username_3: @username_1 
You are correct the date logged by the Google ENF are not provided from or to the CWA. This is ENF data only
Regarding the apps this is correct only system apps pre installed by the manufacture but some manufacture also pre install Facebook this makes it difficult to say the is typical system app from the manufacture.
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_3 thanks for your assessment and support here!
